item.title: Civilization 7 DLC Leaked Ahead Of Reveal
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/civilization-7-dlc-leaked-ahead-of-reveal/

The first set of post-launch DLC scheduled for Civilization 7 has been leaked ahead of its official reveal.

Polygon revealed unannounced leaders, civilizations, and natural wonders ahead of Today’s scheduled announcement from Firaxis and 2K Games. According to the early posting, the following will be coming to Civilization 7 as DLC.

  • Leaders: Ada Lovelace, Simón Bolívar, Xerxes (Achaemenid persona), Friedrich (Baroque persona)
  • Civilizations: Shawnee, Great Britain, Carthage, Bulgaria, Nepal
  • Natural Wonders: Machapuchare, Mount Fuji, Vihren, Vinicunca

The article has since been updated, but the original version of it can be viewed here. For more information on the upcoming DLC, Firaxis Games is holding a Multiplayer and Post-Launch developer stream today (January 30) at 1pm ET. You can watch the livestream below for the latest from the developers.

Civilization 7 launches on February 11 for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, PC, Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 4, and Xbox One. Those who decide to buy one of the more expensive versions of the game will get to play starting February 6, five days before Standard Edition owners.

If you are one that plans on playing Civilization 7 on PC, there are different spec requirements depending on the quality you’re looking from. For those without modern hardware, you can play it on CPUs as old as the Intel Core i3-101000 or AMD Ryzen 3 1200 and graphics cards as old as the Nvidia GTX 1050 and AMD RX 460.

If you want to play it at the highest settings, however, you’ll need at least a 14th-gen Intel CPU or AMD Ryzen 9 5950X along with an Nvidia RTX 4070 or AMD Radeon RX 7800XT.

What do you think about the first set of planned Civilization 7 DLC? Let us know down below, and join more discussions in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, read the latest rumor surrounding Warner Bros. Games’ MultiVersus and check out what game is coming to Netflix Games later this year. And don’t forget to sign up for our newsletter.

item.title: WWE 2K Is Coming To Netflix Games This Year
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/wwe-2k-is-coming-to-netflix-games-this-year/

WWE 2K is joining the Netflix Games library. In an announcement on Thursday morning, WWE and Netflix announced that WWE 2K will be coming to Netflix Games in Fall 2025.

“This isn’t just another mobile game,” WWE superstar CM Punk said in the video announcement. “This is your chance to live the most extreme, the most intense, the most dominant WWE experience right in the palm of your hands.”

Not much is known about the game that’s coming, but it could be assumed, based on the messaging, that the game is a mobile-specific WWE 2K game for the platform as opposed to a version of WWE 2K25. The best comparison could be to how Football Manager is on mobile compared to PC and console.

If you can’t wait that long for a new WWE game, WWE 2K25 launches on March 7 for those who buy the $100 Deadman Edition or $130 Bloodline Edition. If you buy the Standard Edition, you get the game a week later on March 14. That game will be available on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, PC, PlayStation 4, and Xbox One.

Netflix Games is currently available to all subscribers for no extra fees. The library boasts more than 120 mobile games to play. To play games from the library, you need:

  • An active Netflix subscription
  • Android device running Android 8.0 or later
  • iPhone with iOS 15+ or iPad with iPadOS 15+
  • An internet connection to download the game

Are you excited about WWE 2K coming to Netflix Games and mobile devices later this year? Let us know down below, and join more discussions in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, read the latest rumor surrounding Warner Bros. Games’ MultiVersus and check out the leaked new expansion pack for The Sims 4. And don’t forget to sign up for our newsletter.

item.title: MultiVersus Season 5 May Be The End Of The Game, Rumor Suggests
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/multiversus-season-5-end-of-the-game/

MultiVersus could be coming to an end. A new rumor from known MultiVersus leaker AusilMV suggests that the game’s upcoming Season 5 could be the last one.

“[MultiVersus] Season 5 may be the final season of MultiVersus, depending on how it performs,” they said while prefacing that this isn’t confirmed yet.. “A notable source shared this rumor with me, stating that Season 5 may be a “last-ditch effort” for the game.”

Insider Gaming has reached out Warner Bros. Games and developer Player First Games for comment on the rumor. Should a response be received, it will be amended to this story.

RELATED: Year In Review—MultiVersus Had it All And Threw it Away

The idea that MultiVersus could be heading towards a tipping point shouldn’t come as much of a surprise to players and outsiders alike. Since the game launched with high player numbers nearly three years ago, its popularity has dwindled. The game saw a peak player count on Steam of 153,433 players before it fell by 99% within its first few months.

After it struggled to regain traction, Warner Bros. Games announced it was taking the game down in June 2023 after what it then started to call an “open beta” period. It was re-released in May 2024 with numerous updates and changes in the months since. However, it has yet to return to the numbers it had when it first launched and the hype from players was there.

MultiVersus Season 5 is scheduled to start in early February. It’ll be interesting to see what the developers have planned to try and get players to not only pick up their game, but stick around after.

What do you make of the rumors that Season 5 could be MultiVersus’ last? Let us know down below, and join more discussions in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, check out the free games coming to PlayStation Plus members in February and and check out the leaked new expansion pack for The Sims 4. And don’t forget to sign up for our newsletter.
